column1: NGR is Patshull Hall at the correct altitude and relationships to the church and station, although the directions are suspect. The 1860s, 70s and 80s records have the altitude as 400 ft., which is too high for anywhere on the estate but the gauge could have been in a different location, however, the relationship to the church on the 1870s record is consistent with the NGR used. NGR could be +/- 250m.
Note on records says that 1883 to 1888 readings have been corrected for wrong day by comparison with other data.
